description: Results for the latest year include a gain of $2,054,000 on the sale of real estate.

title: TO THE HOME SECTION: I would like to offer an insight to Barbara Ascher that may explain a reason that Cynthia Koestler chose to die with her husband, Arthur Koestler (Hers, March 17).
description: For many years Arthur Koestler was involved in psychic research. Indeed, a large portion of his estate has been left to the continuation of these studies.

title: EDWARD P. LEWIS
description: Edward P. Lewis, former president of the Coca-Cola Bottling Company of New York, died Monday while vacationing in Fort Lauderdale, Fla.

title: NEW YORK DAY BY DAY
description: Satisfying Appetites

title: Debt issues
description: * American Southwest Financial Corp.'s offering of $35.3 million of 12 1/4 percent Government National Mortgage Associationcollateralized bonds, series B, due in 2013, was priced at 98.875 percent plus accrued interest, to yield 12.27 percent, through Salomon Brothers.

title: Transactions; BASEBALL
description: CINCINNATI (NL) - Sent Nick Esa- s ky, third baseman; Tom Lawless, second b aseman, and Brad Lesley and Bill Daw- l ey, pitchers, to farm system. MINNESOTA (AL) - Sent Jesus Vega, f irst baseman; Tim Teufel, second base- m an; Greg Gagne, shortstop; and Paul B oris and Jeff Little, pitchers, to Toledo f arm club.

title: WNCN SALE IS OPPOSED
description: FM, the classical music station that was saved from a future as a rock station when it was purchased by the GAF corporation, could find itself with a new owner once again if an insurgent group of GAF shareholders is successful in taking control of the company.

title: MEN OF ZEAL
description: Alarmist statements about constitutional rights are seldom justified in a country as free as this. But after a meeting here last night I am alarmed: not so much by the details discussed as by the official attitude of mind displayed.

title: HOME IMPROVEMENT
description: AS people spend more time at home, often in small houses and apartments, the problem of noise increases. It may originate outside, in an adjoining apartment or inside the home from television sets, radios, stereo sets, power tools, electric toys and games, dishwashers, clothes washers, food processors and similar appliances.

title: COMPUTERS AS TAX DEDUCTIONS
description: As more people buy personal computers, they are wondering how to treat their new equipment for tax purposes. A couple of general rules can help put things in perspective. First, if the computer is purely for personal use (for playing video games, say, or keeping track of home furnishings for insurance purposes) no tax deduction is available. But if it is used partly in a home business (to keep track of expenses and accounts receivable, for example) and partly for investments (to track the performance of stocks and bonds in your portfolio), some deductions are possible.

title: COLLINS & AIKMAN CORP reports earnings for qtr to Feb 28.
E.P.A. URGED TO PROHIBIT CUTS IN SEWAGE TREATMENT
description: The Federal Environmental Protection Agency has received recommendations to prohibit cutbacks in sewage treatment in the New York metropolitan region from a tristate environmental panel. The agency said yesterday that it not decided to take any action.

title: INTERNATIONAL POWER MACHINES CORP reports earnings for qtr to Dec 31.
description: b-Net income.

title: Rapid City Bank Head Pleased by Citicorp Sale
description: The president of the American State Bank of Rapid City, S.D., will soon be out of a job. But he's happy about that. M. Dwight Guffey founded the bank in 1973, and it now has assets of $15.5 million.

title: Q E D EXPLORATION INC reports earnings for qtr to Jan 31.

COMMODITIES;
Futures Trading Begins In Crude Oil Contracts
description: The New York Mercantile Exchange and the Chicago Board of Trade began trading in two new crude oil contracts yesterday that sponsors say will exert a large influence on the way oil is priced in the future.

title: FAREWELL TO DEMPSEY
description: ''Offense is the best defense'' is a line attributed to the heavyweight champion Jack Dempsey and to the 19th-century Swiss general Antoine Henri Jomini. That has been our nuclear strategy for a generation: our best defense against a knockout blow has been the offensive threat of a near-simultaneous knockout blow in retaliation.

title: GOLDEN ENTERPRISES INC reports earnings for qtr to Feb 28.
TRANSCRIPT OF REAGAN SPEECH ON MISSILE PROPOSAL
description: Following is a transcript of President Reagan's speech in Washington yesterday on intermediate-range nuclear missiles in Europe, as recorded by The New York Times:

title: U.S. Hockey Club Clinches First
description: The United States beat Norway tonight, 8-2, to clinch first place in the world group B hockey championship. The Americans' first-place finish moved them back up to group A for next year's play.

title: STEP ONE: GETTING THE WORLD TO ANSWER YOUR CALLS
description: RUNNING a business out of a residence requires inventiveness, especially for those who have been subjected to corporate coddling. The first step must be to get the outside world to return your telephone calls. Then you should arrange for support services, such as photocopying, message-carrying, typing and all the other amenities that full-time office workers take for granted.

title: Debt Pact Reached By Allis-Chalmers
description: The Allis-Chalmers Corporation said today that it had agreed in principle with its lenders on a plan to meet financing requirements during the next two years.

title: New York Telephone Sets $400 Million Sale
description: The New York Telephone Company disclosed in a filing with the New York State Public Service Commission yesterday that it planned to raise $400 million in the debt market. It would be the company's first such offering since July 1981.
